definition: a monument/an upright stone tablet/stele/CL:塊|块[kuai4],面[mian4]
quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals

sentences.english: Here has also erected a Qing Dynasty inscriptions recording the matter.
sentences.chinese: 至今这里还竖有一清代碑刻记述此事。

sentences.english: The ancient tablets and steles in Nanjing area were largely made of limestone quarried from here.
sentences.chinese: 古代南京地区的碑刻，大多取材于此。

sentences.english: The two existing terrace inscriptions have great historical relics value.
sentences.chinese: 现存的两通露台碑刻，具有很高的历史文物价值。

sentences.english: At the Great Sphinx site, the inscription on a stele erected a thousand years.
sentences.chinese: 狮身人面像附近树立了一千年的石碑载有碑刻铭文。

sentences.english: As funerary objects, "Title deed" is a precious tombstone material.
sentences.chinese: 买地券作为一种随葬明器，是非常宝贵的碑刻材料。

definition: stele/vertical stone tablet for carved inscriptions
a record of events inscribed on a tablet
the top part of a tablet
rock carving/cliff engraving/words carved into cliff face
inscribed stone tablet placed in the tomb/memorial inscription on such a tablet
